alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 7:46PM MST until August 16 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Burn Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 1045 PM MST. * At 744 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fernwood, Timberline, Wupatki Trails, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Hutchison Acres, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument and Sunset Crater Visitors Center. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 424 and 431. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
